oai_dc:dc.dc:title: In camp near Shiloh
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color lithograph of the 1st Regiment, Kentucky Infantry, in camp before the battle of Shiloh. The lithograph is based on a drawing by a soldier in the regiment. Pictured are tents, military equipment, and soldiers involved in various activities, including conversation, cooking, and playing cards.

This lithograph is based on a drawing made by Conrad Wise Chapman, a young American who was raised in Europe. It is a scene in a Confederate camp at Corinth, Mississippi, just prior to the battle of Shiloh. Chapman was a member of the 1st Kentucky Regiment, also known as Wise's Brigade, and was badly wounded at Shiloh. He is considered the most important artist of the Confederacy.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chapman, Conrad Wise
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Shiloh, Battle of, Tenn., 1862; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1862
